step.cmd: Go to Reports > Test Runs > Test Runs.
Navigate to All Test Runs and click a test run ID to go to the selected test run's Summary: click a test run ID

On the selected test run's Summary page, refer to the test results status bar as shown below to view the total number of tests that have Passed, Failed, or are in Error, Incomplete, or Skipped statuses. Test run results summary bar

step.note: The Previous Test Runs section is only available if the test run is executed more than once.
step.cmd: Scroll down to Previous Test Runs to view how your tests performed over time. A test suite on can be run multiple times, such as regression tests that are scheduled to with each product release. The fluctuation trend in test execution time may indicate flakiness or lack of reliability in your test scripts. Previous test runs

step.note: The Sessions section is only available if you have run a configuration with an agent.
step.cmd: Scroll down to the Sessions section to view session logs. To view the logs for a specific session, click the session ID as shown in the screenshot below:View session logs

info.p: You can see the full session log, along with the run command in this page. If you want to re-run the test run, click Run at the upper right corner of the session log modal.

step.cmd: Scroll down to the Failed Test Results section to check for any failed test cases (and the corresponding error that caused it) in your test run. Click the test result ID to view the error and a detailed analysis of the error. Click failed test results ID
Scroll down to the Test Suites section to view execution information including the test suite name, execution profile, operating system and browser, duration and executed date.

info.p:
Click the selected hyperlinked test suite to view:
The test cases enclosed in the selected test suite; and
Execution history of the test suiteView test suite information

step.cmd: Navigate to the Custom Fields and Tags section on the right side as shown below and select from the drop-down list the custom fields and tags to be assigned to your test result. Refer to for more information on how to add or remove custom fields and tags.Test result custom fields and tags

taskbody.result: You have gained relevant information on a test run result.
